description: I am a die hard fan of Pakwan, this is my go-to takeout spot in SF because the quality of the food is consistently great, the servings are generous, and the prices very reasonable. My favorite dishes are the Mixed Vegetable Curry, the Bengan Bhartha (eggplant dish with onions and tomatoes that is just divine), the Chicken Biryani and the Garlic Naan. This is soul food made with love!
author: Tiffany X.

description:
Been here a few times late night, and ordered take out on some nights on the way home.

Food has been consistently fine.

Lamb Biryani is cooked well, and their portion is generally good.

Ask for green and brown chutney if you get take out in case they forget.  I find these add to the flavor in subtle ways.
author: Drew B.

description: It looks like they're doing some remodeling inside but it didn't affect the quality of the food at all.
author: Jennifer R.

description: I ordered delivery and was really disappointed. First they didn't include the raita or papadum that I paid for, and the naan was stale. The tikka masala was ok and the veggie curry ok, but it's a real bummer when you don't get what you pay for. I've had good food here going into the restaurant so I would recommend that, do not order for delivery.
author: Wyatt L.

description:
Indian food is my favorite. This was highly recommended by my two Indian coworkers so I decided to join them for lunch. The food was good but the service was lacking. 

Don't sit down expecting to be served. You will need to grab a menu, Order at the front counter then sit down. They will give you a number that you place on your table as if they will deliver it for you. The food did come pretty fast but it sat on the counter for awhile. We were expecting it to be delivered to our table. We made eye contact with the cashier and he pointed us to the food as if saying "go grab it" 

Utensils are available at the counter and you would need to grab it yourself. If you want some water, you would need to grab it inside a refrigerator and serve yourself. 

This place is a self serve restaurant. Do not expect to have anyone wait on you. You order, pay, eat and go!
author: Rommel Q.

description:
Alright !! so when in America eat as Americans do .. and that is why we were here :D .. they love Indian curry and they love it from here. 
Saw a lot of take away orders flying away and why not .. the curries were quite good .. so were the naan breads. 
Well a bit later about those here ..

So, Pakwan is situated in a quietish street running parallel to a few alleys which are famous for all the wrong reasons. Thus, it is not as crowded as the Halal Guys .. :P .. a few 100 meters away but at the main road.
Jokes apart, if they all put an equal effort to maintain the ambiance and sitting and a few other things .. without a shadow of doubt, with the food they cook, they would become a fan favourite to a lot others .. not just the Indians and Pakistanis and Curry eaters but also to a lot of eager beavers :)

So we ordered 2 curries .. one was lamb and the other chicken .. the former was called "Achar Gosht" achar = pickle gosht = meat .. the other was "karahi chicken" karahi = name of a vessel :) .. 
Both the curries were really really good .. the texture in the meats and the flavors in the curries were just right.
Loved them.
The naan bread were absolutely lovely .. Quantity was great .. 
Overall, a great dinner.. Not that it was to our taste and all but overall the food was really nice.

Hope they invest a bit in overhauling the ambiance and a little attention to detail.. it would pay dividends for sure.
author: Wasil K.

description:
The small one block stretch on Jones between Geary & O'Farrell hosts three Pakistani/Indian restaurants namely Shalimar, Chutney and Pakwan that I decided to try, to find one that I could stick with on a regular basis. After trying Shalimar and then Chutney, I decided to try Pakwan. Pakwan is located in the heart of the hood so apart from letting you know that you have to basically ignore panhandlers on your way here and back, I'm going to spare you other details.

At the peak dinner hour unlike Shalimar & Chutney Pakwan seemed to be pretty empty with a lot of open tables. This seemed strange and I almost walked out but changed my mind at the last minute and decided to try it out. To keep things simple, I decided to get what I had got at Chutney a couple of days ago namely the Chicken Tikka Masala ($9.99) and a couple of plain naan ($1.50) to-go. After ordering as I sat at one of the empty tables I did notice that the place was cleaner than both Shalimar and Chutney and seemed like a regular restaurant that was cleaned periodically. Wait time was also not much and I was out in under 10 minutes. The restaurant is self-service so you basically pick up your desired silverware from the counter before you leave.

Taste is where Pakwan was a failure. The chicken tikka masala was essentially pieces of boiled chicken in a tomato puree. No exaggeration just cubed boiled chicken and a tomato sauce that did not even have enough spices to hide the sweet tomato taste. The naan was extremely soft and could have used a little more time in the tandoor, which made it extremely chewy. A couple of bites into this meal it was clear to me why this place was half empty while Shalimar and Chutney were packed to capacity. The food simply does not compare to the other two. This seemed to be made by amateur cooks who were trying to make something off a recipe that they did not understand or care to learn about. 

Price wise Pakwan was 30% more expensive than Shalimar and 15% more expensive than Chutney but the food was not even in the same league as Shalimar or Chutney. Goes without saying I have no intention of returning to Pakwan and will stick with Chutney and Shalimar for my Pakistani/Indian food fix in the hood.
author: Ahmad J.

description: The food was really good and came in big portions. We got chicken biryani and lamb curry. What else can one ask for. Mango lassi wasn't super sweet either, which I like.
author: Shiya L.

description: I ordered pakora as part of my take out. I arrived and after I paid I was told they didn't have pakora and I was offered samosas instead. No big deal, but I asked if they were gluten free because my girlfriend has a gluten allergy. They said they weren't sure. Also no big deal - I don't expect every place to know what has gluten and what doesn't. I asked if I could just get refunded the amount, upon which the cashier tried to assure me the samosas are gluten-free. After leaving the restaurant, I looked them up and, sure enough, samosas are wheat-based ... I don't blame a restaurant for making order mistakes, or for not knowing all the nutritional details of their menu, but it's unacceptable to disregard your customers' allergies and lie about the contents of your food just to avoid refunding an appetizer.
author: Richard C.

description: I'm really sad this place I'm visit Thursday night we ordered goat curry and rice im tell him I need mild but he tell me not haved mild but he got angry and said go
author: Somnath R.

description:
This is my favorite Pakwan out of all Pakwans - their kebabs and chicken byrani are amazing.

Their beef gosht is pretty good as well.
author: Hien P.

description:
The food is inexpensive, well prepared and authentic, all at the same time. 
We tried multiple veggie curries including chhole, palak paneer etc, everything was really good and everyone at our table of 4 appreciated the food and quality. 
The young guy who runs the place hails from Hyderabad but runs it with a Pakistani cook. 
Ambience is casual and rather upscale.
author: Ritu W.

description:
A delightful no-frills spot for Indian hitting all the right TandoorLoin notes: counter service, open table, free hot milk chai. They raised prices recently and I can't say without justification, because it used to be a steal; the result is a solid choice I patronize sometimes with a price-value mix in four-star territory. If you like the one in the Mission this one is a solid alternative.

Opening hours until 11 p.m. make it even more useful.

Best advice for bargain hunters, especially veggie-friendly and veggie-only types: Order the vegetable biryani. I did on my last visit and out came a mountain of food, with the chai more than enough for a gut-busting feast with half remaining for lunch the next day. At under $10 it's an excellent value I can get behind.
author: James D.

description: Pretty decent Pakistani / Indian place. Seems to be several locations, the other is near Misson & 16th St which I've been to many times and is very good. This one is in the scarier part of town and not quite as good. It's kind of self service like the other location, but doesn't seem to have as much of a selection on the menu. But the food is still pretty good.
author: Peter K.

description: The food was very okay .. not great .., we ordered paneer makhni, garlic naan , both were good. Vegetable biryaani was horrible .. everything else was manageable. Not great , not good , it's okay !
author: Indraja D.

description: Their lamb biriyani is to die for. Generous portion and the quality of the Biriyani was high. Being an Asian I asked them to make it spicy and it was spicy.
author: Madhu J.

description:
I knew the Pakwan order-at-the-counter routine from the 16th Street location where all the hipsters go and hang. I had never tried the Tenderloin location before because I was usually finished with a meal by the time I saw it or in a hurry to get home and not in the mood to dawdle on this stretch of Jones if you know what I mean. And I think you do. Anyhow, I just happened to feel peckish enough one evening to stop into a nearly empty restaurant. Formica tables were a bit in a disarray, but I made my way through to the front counter where the server appeared indifferent to my presence.

Regardless, I plunged ahead and gave my order. Since I didn't see my standby Bhindi Masala on the menu, I went for the $6.99 Bengan Bhartha, which was a specialty dish, eggplant cooked with onions and tomatoes (photo: http://bit.ly/29ePXoj). Pretty tasty if a bit soupy that it took a lot of careful spooning of the $1.99 Basmati Rice to get the slightly mushy eggplant into my mouth without major spillage issues arising (photo: http://bit.ly/29kJIwc). For my main, I ordered the $12.99 Tandoori Lamb Chops, which were marinated in a special spice mix that brought out the tandoori char in the meat (photo: http://bit.ly/29q71a9).

Once again, it was just pretty good as the portions were a bit on the paltry side for the price and the lamb a tad too dry to provide complete satisfaction. A complimentary glass of Masala Tea provided a bit of compensation but not nearly enough (photo: http://bit.ly/29jyLgT). In the meantime, Tenderloin regulars came in and out with their orders, although interestingly, very few of them stayed and sat down to eat here. After all, this is a working class Pakistani-Indian diner, not a dining destination to tell your friends in Pac Heights to hop into their Teslas to get to. Know what I mean?

FOOD - 3 stars...middling when it comes to the quality of the dishes
AMBIANCE - 2 stars...well, people don't come here for the ambiance
SERVICE - 2 stars...surly and then some
TOTAL - 3 stars...not as cheap like it used to be but OK for no-frills subcontinent food
author: Ed U.

description: The chicken plate I ordered was so greasy. I tried to open it as carefully as possible  but still got grease all over jeans and hands. I love Indian food and was looking forward to trying Pakistani food. It's also in tenderloin and unsafe.
author: Leah B.

description:
Excellent and down-to-earth. First timers will stumble a bit with the ordering process. Food is great, spicey, predictable. Drink choices are minimal but all you really need is a mango lasse, right? Not fancy. 
The area is a little rough. Don't mind the naked hobo walking by.
author: Andy D.

description:
Second best indian food in the city~  second location that is!

I've been frequenting Pakwan for a while. To a point that I'd plan my work/personal trip around this area so I can stay close by and eat here!! It's no secret that I loveee the food from here. I'm pretty sure almost everyone that knows me know about this spot. They are pretty magic!

Came to this place on a Saturday morning after we arrived in the city. It was empty! And it is byob so we came prepared with our own bottle of wine and such!

Ambiance- much smaller than mission location. 
Self-serve place with smaller kitchen. They call your number, you go get your food. So you definitely need to have a table especially if you want to order many dishes like me.The menus are at the counter- it's cash only!  

Food-
There may or may not have been a vegetarian section on the menu but seriously? Who'd look at it when you have so many amazing meat choices. 
They have kebobs, chicken /beef/lamb curries, biryanis (chicken, mutton) and $1 chai!! Zomg. So many to choose. It is also a mixture of North Indian and South Indian food. Talk about the best of both world. 

1. Biryani - it was well spiced! So tasty and spicy!! Need to be a little hotter in temp but it was tasty!!Two non indians including me tolerated that spice really well, if not loved it.

2. Kabobs- nicely spiced. Tasty with loads of fresh onions and jalapenos.
3. Chicken curry  - with jalapenos and fresh ginger slices on top. This was probably the spiciest dish we had on the table.
4. Nihari with lamb shank- yummmm! This one came with a huge lamb shank. Again, so well spiced that curry is. Nice, thick, tasty with a kick. 

The portions were nice and big. Massive even!! And the best part- they were all around $9-$11 per entrée. I mean, wow! I'd probably skip the super spicy chicken next time. Or try a dish chicken dish but the rest were totally point on and mind blowing. 

Did I mention that they give you a pile of peppers with every dish? It's like an added bonus heat to already nicely spiced dishes. Actual spicy peppers. So hot, you wont stop eating! Yes, SF has so many Indian restaurants and yes, you can find amazing biryani else where. But since I've had their food in Mission, I've been hooked. And this place actually delivers for free. I've been there during a cold chilly spring time and didn't want to walk to this area, they delivered it.

Minus one star for location/ambiance and for the service. I've yet to come here and see this place busy.  But I did see some shady deals going down as we sat and enjoyed our food by the windows! Love the food though!!
author: Latifa S.

description: I love Indian food personally like I can eat all three meals in a day. So I tried other Indian restaurants around this area and compared them. This becomes my favorite Indian restaurant. I love the portion of the food they give. It could be 2 meals! And while I am waiting for the food, I always have a free Indian tea next to the casher. It's really great milk tea favor. I love it!
author: Jeongwoo W.

description:
Indian food has always been comforting to me. After a night of drinking, there's nothing like a good chicken tikka masala the next day. It's creamy comfort. There's a bunch of Indian joints in the TL by work, so I decided to grab take out for dinner on Friday, November 20th. I placed an order through Eat24 before I left work. It was ready about 5 mins after I walked there.

*Samosa ($3.99)
*Chicken tikka masala: boneless white meat in a creamy sauce ($9.99)
*Garlic nan ($2.25)
*Onion nan: nan stuffed with onions ($2.99)

The samosas were good. Crispy on the outside, soft on the inside. Great with their mint chutney. The naan were good as well. Soft with a nice chew. The disappointing dish was the main event. The chicken tikka masala. I'm not sure if I went on an off night, but the chicken was super dry. And the curry itself didn't have much flavor. I ordered mine very spicy. It had a great heat to it, but where was the creamy, tomatoey richness I was looking for? All I tasted was the heat and dry chicken, not much else.

Maybe ordering my curry very spicy overpowered the rest if the flavors, but that dry tough chicken? There was no excuse for that!
author: Elena N.

description: Yes, this is a self-serve sort of place. If you don't have preconceived expectations then you'll be outstandingly surprised at the food. All one really has to do is read the signs that are in blatant view that say order here, pick up here, and self-service. get past the preconceive notion's and the food is outstanding. Which is really the reason you're here, right?
author: Uncle S.

description: Saag Paneer and Eggplant dishes were delicious and vegetarian samosas were a treat! Short wait for takeout. Recommend!
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Best chicken boti kebab I have ever eaten; huge portion, perfectly cooked with a juicy interior and a nice, spicy, slightly crusty exterior from the grill. All you get is the chicken, a couple of lime wedges, and some raw onion, so need to order rice, or nan separately. Highly recommended for food.

Place was clean but a bit dingy and in a so so part of town. If they did a bit of decorating they could turn this into a really great place for authentic Pakistani food
author: Mark M.

description: This made me and my wife terribly sick. Its funny because I love Pakwan in the Mission, and my company would always order from there. My Coworker Roh said never mess with the Loin pakwan because it got him sick. Sure enough the first time I eat here the next day was spent wearing out the carpet to my bathroom before succumbing to wrapping around a toilet in the fetal position.
author: Aaron S.

description:
Ordered Chicken Dum Biriyani, Chicken tandoori leg, and Chicken Karahi. the food was ample for the price no complaints there. the hygiene of the place is so so. it is not maintained well and the kitchen floors and crevices have old food and makes you worry about health. 

the biriyani was not dum for sure, it was more of made to order stirred up with biriyani sauce. the chicken in the biriyani was well cooked and there was plenty of it. 

the tandoori chicken was good can use a little bit more of spice but can understand that it was toned down to cater to all audience.

the chicken karahi had so much oil in it. the color of the dish was right but lacked a bit of flavor punch.

having said all the above. will I go again to this place yes as the food was ok not great. will go for a quick bite during lunch, but not for a relaxed family meal.
author: Suresh D.

description:
Holy shit. My nan had fiberglass in it.

I returned my food, and they told me it was just "nonstick coating inside the oven". After telling them I didn't want a replacement unless I knew what that coating was, etc they showed me the oven and it was so black and charred and cracked it was leaking insulation.

Don't eat here. Clearly, customer safety isn't even a slight concern when checking their equipment.
author: Sam S.

description: I have been ordering from Pakwan for years now - my go-to Indian food fix. My only peeve is the delivery - my last delivery took 2 hours (!) but they did refund me for the cost of the meal. I get that they're a popular restaurant and deliveries can take a while but either let customers know that it'll be two hours so they can order from someplace else or get more drivers!
author: Smita S.

description: Awesome food but perhaps good for a take out only. He restaurant is really a mess. I highly recommend that the owners invest some money in making the restaurant a bit cleaner. The place and ambience does not do the justice to the food served. I have been to the Pakwan in Hayward many times and that place is much better. Three stars just for that reason.
author: Vipul B.

description:
I know everyone raves about this place, and yes ... it is in the tenderloin but I have to say for many reasons I'm not very impressed. The food flavor was great, but both he and I got a stomach ache afterwards from having their chicken curry special of the day and the lamb biryani. 

While I was there, a homeless lady came in through the door, and took a soda off the remains of an empty table from some people who left. It is likely that the restaurant would have thrown away the soda, but they actually sent a guy outside to wrestle the soda out from her hands. She came in and asked for the soda again because they were going to toss it out, and they basically roughhoused her outside until her pants fell and she came crying in the restaurant again and ended up taking another customer's soda. She became belligerent and yelled out that she just wanted the soda but the staff was rude and continued to what I would say abuse her and handle her roughly (physically).

This left a pretty bad taste in my mouth. As much as I understand how a business in the tenderloin needs to protect themselves and give a good experience to their customers, I don't really think that this was a great way to handle this particular situation. Homelessness in the tenderloin is a pervasive problem and they're honestly just making it worse. A little compassion could go a long way. 

I won't be coming back.
author: Lorrie M.

description:
The fact that this place could possibly have fewer than five stars is a mystery. I've tried pretty much every Indian place in a four block radius of here (and that's a lot of Indian food, let me tell you) and this place was hands-down, without question, the best. 

I got the Chicken Karahi, Saag Gosht, rice, and a piece of naan. The chicken dish was filled with flavorful pieces of dark meat, the lamb was juicy and tender, and both sauces were chock full of spices--Pakwan is not screwing around. The naan--hell, even the rice--was at least 10X better than any others in this hood. 

Go. Eat. And then go again and again and again. Some people in the Tenderloin are addicted to crack. I am now addicted to Pakwan.
author: Ellen E.

description: Wonderful food.  The Biryani was fantastic along with the alloo palak (spinach and potatoes).  Checked out 4 Indian restaurants.  This one was the best.
author: Sue M.

description:
Consensus shows this location isn't as good as the other one. Not sure what falls short, but I've never been disappointed after a meal here and haven't been to the one on 16th street. 

Their food is flavorful, spicy af (if you ask for it to be), and super fresh. There's quite a lot to choose from on the menu. 

What I find myself going back to repeatedly for starters is the Tandoori Chicken Boti because it's always super juicy and grilled well. I then like to mix it up and order a couple different curries and vegetarian dishes. 

While the Chicken Achar is another favorite, the Bengan Bhartha is also quite delicious. I love that both vegetarian dishes and meat dishes are paid attention to with the same level of flavor detail. I guess you can't go wrong.

Four stars because even when you order meat dishes, the ratio of meat to curry is pretty off. You get 3x the meat and 1x curry. Hardcore carnivores may love this, I like more of a balance especially when choosing naan over rice.  

Pretty content with service, nbd. Most Indian restaurants that are more on the authentic side (this might be more standard in the South though) tend to just drop your order off and not check on you, it is what it is, yo!
author: Shereen A.

description:
Here food is good.  They need to stop watering down their sauces.  That is only the reason I took away one star. The food was good and spicy.  Their chicken tikka was okay not the best.  I am comparing them to lahori kharai which has set the standard and has the best Pakistani / Indian cusine.  If you want the best go there. 

Ps I like spicy paki food with a lot of flavor.
author: Faraz S.

description:
We've been looking for good Indian/Pakistani food around our neighborhood that delivers.  We've tried a bunch and all failed the test until Pakwan.  We were very happy with the food and will be reordering.

But the what I want to highlight is their service, friendliness and generosity.  We accidentally ordered for pick up but wanted delivery.  Once I discovered, I called them and they quickly said they'd deliver for us even though the delivery charge wasn't included.  I thanked them.  They delivered quickly and I had a nice tip to give the driver.  When I offered he just smiled and declined.  I've never had this happen and it just impressed me.  

Thank you Pakwan.  You've earned a customer with the way you do business.
author: Shane S.

description:
Solid Indian at a good price.
Ambience: Okay, not great on this factor, but I got take-out so it wasn't a problem. Only a few tables in a  small place with very basic dining tables and service. Food cooked so close that you can't help but leave with some odor clinging to you.
Service: Fast, but patchy. We had to correct our order a few times.
Food: Very good. We had the tandoori chicken boti, naan, mixed curried veggies, and lamb korma. All were good and tasty without being overpowering or derivative. Nothing special but if this were typical I'd look to this a reliable option in the future. One thing though, we didn't get offered rice with that order, as we'd sort of taken it for granted that two mains and a side would come with some, but no.
Price: Good value.
I'd be willing to have this as a regular take-out option.
author: Geoff A.

description:
This was my second time at Pakwan after 2 years. I don't really remember the first time, but I definitely can say that Pakwan is one of the more nicer Pakistani/Indian restaurants in SF Bay Area. 

This time, we ordered chicken tikka (tandoori), chicken tikka masala, garlic naan, mango lassi's and a side of rice. The chicken tikka was GOOD. It had the right balance between crispy and tender. I wasn't losing any teeth trying to eat it, and the blend of spices was phenomenal. The chicken tikka masala, in my opinion, was a little on the bland side. I don't think that the chicken pieces had blended well with the sauce (Salan), and you could tell by the taste. I don't have to comment on the garlic naan because if you have ever had garlic naan, you know how awesome-sauce it is! 

As for the mango Lassi's - if you do not go for anything else, GO for the lassi's.  Disclaimer: Do not operate any heavy machinery after consuming such deliciousness, as it might get you drowsy. It happens to me all the time! 

I will definitely be visiting Pakwan the next time I am in SF iA.
author: Anum W.

description:
Parking is a mess so it is best to order delivery or to have one more person with you so you can take food to go. Food was incredible. Truly authentic taste. Would go back if I'm ever in San Francisco

Tandoori Chicken Breast was great. Truly captures the taste of Chicken Tikka that you would find in Pakistan. The spice might bother some people though. 

The Tandoori Chicken Boti and the Bihari Boti Kabab were really good. Get it with naan.

Avoid the Biryani. It is always a letdown when restaurants add potatoes to it. Completely messes up the taste. 

The prices were very reasonable as well. 

It is better to call your order instead of doing it online to make sure they have the item in stock. If they are out of an item it makes it a mess trying to get a refund.
author: Ayaz H.

description:
We got the chicken biryani and lamb karhai. The prices are reasonable and the taste good. My mom was very impressed with the biryani. They also didn't skimp on the meat which was nice.

We went on Christmas night so the restaurant was very crowded and there was only one guy who was wiping down tables. Also, there were a ton of take out orders which was slowing down the food being cooked for in house customers. Probably took 30-40 minutes to get food which was understandable under the circumstances. 

As others have mentioned probably not very sanitary or clean so if that's what you're looking for stay away.
author: Saadiya R.

description: The original location with friendly service and quick orders. Love the saag paneer especially for the texture and depth of flavor compared to other places.
author: Danielle T.

description: Naan was good while seekh kabab and tikka were ok with very mild spices. They don't serve and sauces or raita which was very disappointing
author: Muhammad S.

description: Good food, good service, they could have added a bit more lamb, but that's me. Definitely a go to spot in my book.
author: Michael S.

description: Would not recommend - we were so excited to get our Sunday takeout from here as it came highly recommended but it was a disappointment.  Though it tasted alright, there was a layer of oil on the top. We over-ordered naan assuming there was something to scoop..there was nothing.  Try somewhere else!
author: Malia J.

description:
Firstly, we have never been here but have always ordered home from here.

I think this must be the 4th or 5th time ordering lamb Biryani and it has never failed me (except once, but the exceptional customer service made up for that).
While I have found my staple, my husband loves to experiment with the curries and till date he has lived all of them (Achari chicken, bhuna lamb). Naan is well made and the accompaniments are flavorful and more than enough for one person! I usually have some left over for lunch the next day as well.

As for the service, I am more than happy with it. They are prompt with delivery. And the one time I was unhappy with their Biryani they offered one free the next time around, which frankly impressed me a lot. 

I used to look for good places to get my Indian fix from, but I think the search has ended for me. For now.
author: Shruti D.

description: Low key place but food is amazing . If you looking for some hot spicy Indian food get the chicken achar . Prices are right and portions good. Enjoyed the food . Nothing fancy just good food
author: Manoj S.

description: First time at this restaurant. Goat biriyani, chicken kabob and lamb curry, overall great flavor. Service was decent, but the number thing didn't make sense, when I was handed the number, I was expecting a server to bring the food to the table. But we ordered, picked a table and then picked up the food when it was ready. At 9:30 pm I was happy to have the food so quickly. May come back to try other dishes, even though I am not a fan of the surrounding area.... dirty and stinky.....lots of homeless people and possibly some illegal deals going on there as well....that's Tenderloin. Inside the restaurant it was ok. Probably a better idea is to take it 'to go' or have it delivered and enjoy it in the comfort of your home. That way you are not gonna be hit by stinky side walks right after having a great meal while walking to car!
author: Ash A.

description:
A foodie friend recommended this place. Had to walk through a little undesirable area but sooooo worth it. Oh my goodness!  Every plate was amazing!  There was no one when we walked in, but lots of carry out. Don't let an empty room here deter you. The place filled up right after we sat down.  We ordered too much food but their prices are so great we wanted to try multiple flavors. 

Don't forget the green sauce and free chai tea!
author: Jennifer G.

description: We came here for a quick bite to eat simply because it was open late night after we enjoyed a few drinks across the street. The food and service were terrible--and I am taking into consideration that this is a "late night, get some grub" kind of a joint. The dishes were subpar, food hat should have been hot were served refrigerated cold, and they did not want to make enough chai for our group. Most disappointing of all was the chicken tikka masala. I'm dumbfounded how meat simmered in a sauce can be extremely dry and tasteless; it's a special talent.
author: Rebecca W.

description: Excellent service and food is good and decently priced. Other than the one odd time something wasn't fresh, it mostly is. This is my go to place to get biryani and samosas.
author: Saud B.

description: We ordered butter chicken, chicken biryani, palak paneer and some naan. The butter chicken only came with sauce and chicken, no rice or anything. Overall the food was pretty good, but at $35 for take out it was quite overpriced and the service was not good at all.
author: Grady J.

description: Pakwan makes the best Chicken tandoori. I stop for lunch at Pakwan at least once a week for lunch.  I always leave satisfied.
author: Abdolloh d.

description:
This place is hella nasty!!! 
Ok food,but don't ever sit here and try to eat. 
Kitchen is a loud ruckus, flies in the dining area, crack heads walking in every minute asking for food or money
author: Yonus A.

description: My favorite Pakistani / Indian in the city. Must get the saag paneer and tandoori chicken. Yellow daal also outstanding!
author: Daniel S.

description: I got food poisoning from the Chicken Tikka Masala. I called the restaurant to let them know so they could monitor how they cook/store their food but the employee on the phone would repeatedly ask me "what is the problem ma'am?" Don't eat hear. Not worth spending your entire day hugging the toilet.
author: Shelly N.

description:
I've been craving Indian food for the longest time and because I kept seeing that my little sis was going, I wanted to go with her. She normally goes to the other location but this was closer to her work so we decided to try it out. From her, she says that it's just as good! 

When I walked it, you pass all the tables and make it to the register where you order, you're given a number and you sit. I thought that because they give you a number that they would bring it to your table, but they actually call out your number and you go pick it up. Everything is pretty much self served. We ordered the Chicken Tikka Masala and the Chicken Achar. Both were delicious! Oh! We also got some garlic naan! Amazing!! 

The chicken tikka masala had the perfect amount of flavor! The chicken achar had a great spicy kick to it. Wasn't expecting it but I didn't mind it at all. Shares those two dishes with my little sis! We couldn't even finish it because we got so full! 

I would definitely like to come back again!
author: Janet T.

description: Food tastes so good. Didn't realize it was self serve. . So waited until I figured it out. Duh! Simple but clean. Ambiance is nothing to speak of. Cashier was friendly. Located in an interesting neighborhood. . So if you like people watching this is the place to go.
author: S. C.

description:
Chicken tiki excellent .
Chicken curry great
Bread good
Rice awesome 

Service ok. I get confused why they hand out numbers but you have to get up to get your own food. 

Also how did they run out of lamb and chicken kabobs ???
author: Justin I.

description:
This is a review of the catered lunch which my company ordered.

The delivery was done way ahead of time and the food smelled so good it got everyone hungry before lunch time. I enjoyed the Chicken Tikka Masala a lot. The chicken was tender and the spices were great. The saag gosht and saag Paneer were amazing with the naan/ rice as well. 

The samosas were also generous in filling. Definitely one of the better Indian food that I've tried.
author: Christina N.

description:
Simply put, damn good, decent portions and good price.

Pluses:

Free/complimentary hot milk tea (really really good)

Clean

Great fast staffs

Friendly and no fuses if you bring in a beer ( not encourage ) to enjoy your meal there.

Minuses:

None.
author: Danny X.

description: The food here was fantastic!  And you can't beat the price for the amount of food you get.  Had the Saal Daal and the spice was just the right amount.
author: Elements Of Light L.

description: Came here to eat with my boyfriend. It's one of those self serve places Like you get your chai and your silverware and napkins from a condiment station and order at the register and they call your food out for you. And I loved it. The chicken tikka masala was top notch and I could literally eat their naan for days. The portions are HUGE. (1 entree is arguably big enough for two but it's so good you'll want one just for yourself) don't forget to try the Mango Lassi! definitely recommend to everyone that enjoys a good, filling meal.
author: Bev S.

description: Amazing food. Chicken Biriyani and Palak Paneer were some of the best I've had in a long time. Located in the area with lots of Pakistani restaurants.
author: Mia C.

description: The Chicken briyani was good. they do not serve any side dishes
author: Bob N.

description:
Best indian/Pakistani food in the city. We always pick up and its consistent and never disappoints.
Recommendations/favs: Lamb biryani, lamb spinach, Chicken Tikka Masala, naan, bihari boti, and the best tandoori lamb chops.
author: Aubrey K.

description:
This is the best Indian restaurant I have ever been to. I will go out of my way to eat here.

The curries are good. I love their Aloo Palak. But, the real life changing, mind altering dish they have is the Biryani. You must get this. Order a curry for sure...they are good. But you must have the Biryani.

The staff have always been kind. The food is reasonably priced and I have never had a bad experience. To paraphrase Ben Franklin "Indian Food is proof that God loves us and wants us to be happy." But especially the Biryani. Did I mention the Biryani?
author: Chris W.

description:
I go here all the time when craving Indian food. The main reason : Naan bread! 
It's one of the softest I have eaten in the bay area. Combine the naan with any of their chicken or goat curries and you are all set! 
Their tandoori appetizers are also something to vouch for and last but not the least- goat biryani!
When I had almost given up on finding a good biryani place in the city,I found them!
The rice flavoring is amazing and so are the caramelized onions used for topping along with the tender spiced goat meat. Heaven!
author: Neil S.

description:
I've been to the Hayward location many times and also the Mission location.  This one. Is much smaller.  But the food is all equally tasty.  Free hot tea.

It was abuzz at 9 pm tonight and we had to wait 20 minutes for our to go order

As always  we love their dal  (we had the one with lentils and spinach), Chicken Achar (chicken curry with roasted pepper cooked in blend of spices), I took a star off because this was the first time there was no pepper in the dish, normally there is a whole pepper included. It was our first to go order  and it seemed they skimped vs. portions you get when eating in the restaurant.

Two orders of garlic naan, a garbanzo bean (Chana masala) side dish and the lamb.   Loved everything.

We walked here from SF Playhouse where we had seen Colossal.
author: Foodlover B.

description:
This was one of the first restaurants I went to when I first moved to SF. And all I can say is, they have the best indian food ever! Amazing choices for fellow vegetarians and amazing prices as well. 

I tried most of the vegetarian dishes but my all time favorite would be the Saag Paneer with Rice. 

It costs around $11 and if you manage to eat the entire portion, you won't be able to move for the next 30 minutes. 

It is true that it does not look like the prettiest or fanciest restaurant but yea, the food is what counts. 

I tried countless other indian places in the Tenderloin but nothing is as good and as cheap as this one. 

When I move back to Europe I will cry for not being able to have my favorite indian takeout food!
author: Magdalena Victoria B.

description: The best Indian / Pakistani food in San Francisco. Highly recommend - chai, seekh kabab, grill fish, tandoori chicken and achar chicken curry.
author: Neha H.

description:
The best chicken tandooris. 

I love Indian food and pakwan one of the best for sure. This guys have the best chicken tandoori for sure. 

Make sure that u have ordered chicken breast tandoori...
author: Jay M.

description:
Absolutely filthy. I'm surprised that I agreed to eat here but it only became apparent after we had ordered and paid for the food. At first glance when you enter it looks like a run of the mill Indo-Pakistani restaurant (most are not the cleanest anyway). But this place? They must be bribing the health inspector to keep their doors open. I literally saw a knife covered in meat and blood just sitting on a counter in public space. Every inch of the kitchen is covered in dirt and grime - even their spice buckets are blackened with God knows what. 

Aside from the cleanliness factor, the food is alright. We had seekh kabobs which were greasy but flavorful and chicken tikka boti which was flavorful as well but heavily salted. 

Overall, there are SO many Pakistani restaurants to choose from in SF there's no reason to eat here and risk your health.
author: Mira N.

description: Great food for a low price. Spicy food especially good. Easy to get dishes with little or no added sugar.
author: Nikolai Y.

description:
2.5 stars. Paneer makhani sauce was nice but the paneer was dry and rubbery. Lamb gosht and tandoori chicken were decent but nothing special. The chicken was barely lukewarm. 

There are numerous other places to get Indian food for the same price within a block of this place and they all serve much tastier food. 

We tried Pakwan just for something different. Instant regret ensued.
author: Dan I.

description: Last minute option. Food is OK. Too spicy and oily which could give you a heart-burn. Ask for mild spicy before ordering. You get free tea if you order food.
author: Ann S.

description:
I've been eating here for 2 years now . I am Biryani enthusiast and I get biryani from here at least twice a week! Love the food and service especially for a place in the tenderloin area.  The place is great for take out they  prepare your food really quick and fresh. I love spicy food and they customize the spice in my food on request. 

The biryani portion is really good for the price . If you are looking for south indian hyderabadi /ambur  biryani etc then this is not the place for you( Don't complain if you don't get what you're looking for) . The biryani here is unique in its own way and has definitely won a place in my heart among other biryani varieties. 

The naan is really soft and fluffy  and freshly made in the tandoor pot . 
I also like the chicken boti kebab - Tender , well marinated and cooked well .
In the curry variety I like achari chicken , Nihari and Bhuna gosht ( Minced lamb) totally worth the money .

When I am not having biryani I usually kill the craving by have a samosa or two . Its kinda oily but good . 
The best thing about my pakwan experience when I walk back home and the aroma of the food from the bag makes other people ask me what food I got :D especially in the elevator ! their expression is worth it !
author: Nikita R.

description: I like this Fast food Indian cuisine that's open late until 10:30pm. Avoid the chai tea. Because it tastes like badly diluted black tea. The Karahi chicken curry is nicely done. Lots of seating.
author: Susan T.

description:
Okay, so this place from the outside doesn't look like much, but honestly it's great if you're looking for good authentic Pakistani food. 
You order in front and pick up right next to the cashier once your order is ready.
I ended up ordering the garlic naan with the lamb curry.
The garlic naan wasn't overpowering and it was crisped and charred in the utmost perfect way. It was just pretty amazing naan.
The lamb curry just melts in your mouth. The meat is fall-apart tender. The curry itself has amazing flavor, and something to definitely try if you like lamb!
Overall great experience.
author: Jenny M.

description: After eating here twice I realize this is the best Indian food in the tenderloin even better than shalimar. Their curries have more tender lamb and have a spicy kick I haven't found else where. The service is sparse the servers don't bring you anything you look out for your food and bring it to your own table.
author: N A.

description: Fantastic food, good portion size, and reasonably priced. The mango lassis were delicious!
author: Lindsay F.

description:
How I want to love Pakwan but my bowels wont let me.  I have heard stories from many people who travel to India about the dangerous escapades of the food.  Enjoy a great meal but end up sweating like a horror in church in the bathroom as your backside explodes like the tech boom of 2000.  
The Positives:  Love it that you can BYOB!  Ordered a kabab, the tikki masala, rice, lentils, nan and a great eggplant dish.  All the food was very tasty and filled us up for $15 bucks a man.  Post meal we decided to walk the neighborhood and breathe in the wonderful flavors of the TL.  Saw a woman with her pants around her ankles rubbing hummus all over her body around the corner....not a site I hope to replicate again.
Headed home and made it about 8 blocks to Larkin....think Dumb and Dumber bathroom scene - tell my buddy to pull over and I run into Lers Roos Thai.  The hostess asked how many in my party - I say 3..the wait about 10 minutes - I quickly pass her and run upstairs to the bathroom with the backside clenched tightly.  Luckily make it to the bathroom which I barely fit in and BOOM ..... Atom Bomb or should I say Boneman Bomb!  10 minutes later with a little sweat on my back I head out....apologies in advance to the poor guy walking up the stairs into the bathroom - I know I ruined your meal - I owe ya one!
That will be my last time to Pakwan..unless I wear a depends.
author: Tim G.

description: Not as good as the Pakwan restaurant in the mission. The food there is much better and consistent.  Way to spicy and oily. They don't know how to balance the flavors. Need to improve.
author: CEDRIC D.

description: The have three Pakwan in sf  3 best restaurant 1 Palawan 2 Pakwan  3 Pakwan  3 location  jones st Valencia st   Stone town 100 person halal ? Ask
author: A S.

description: Favorite Indian food in SF. The Tenderloin is packed with good smelling joints, but on a friend's recommendation, I came here. Got the chana masala, lamb biryani, and chicken achar. The best!
author: Christopher R.

description:
Mixed review

Haleem was just a curry here.
Roti and other curries are good.
Chicken Biryani and goat biryani are authentic pakistani.
author: Siva Sankar G.

description: The food was pretty good. I ordered the Chicken Briyani and lots of flavor. Staff was friendly. Bathroom was in the basement.
author: Leonia T.

description:
Pakwan delivered a great Mother's Day meal and fantastic service. 

We were mistakenly charged twice but the manager gave us free desserts as an apology which was extremely generous and definitely not needed since they voided the extra charge! It was such a nice gesture and unexpected. 

I grew up in a Pakistani household and the food here satisfies my craving for a home cooked Pakistani meal. We had the Karahi Chicken, Tandoori Chicken Breast, Tandoori Chicken Boti, and Chicken Tikka Masala. All of it was delicious -- no complaints! The gulab jamun was great as well. 

Come here if you're looking for some genuinely tasty Indian/Pakistani food.
author: Amber B.

description:
Pakwan is my favorite Indian food in San Francisco. These are my favorites: Chicken Achar, Chicken Tandoori, Aloo Naan. Always check their specials.. their Goat Biryani, Lamb Vidaloo and Keema are awesome. 

Also love the BYOB nature of this place. The servers are very friendly, and there is always plenty of seating available. However, doing anything in the Tenderloin is an acquired taste. The neighborhood is a little dicey, and the restrooms are pretty unclean. But you can't really beat the deliciousness of Pakwan. I usually stay away from their vegetarian offerings.. but you can't really go wrong if you are looking for North Indian food in  the city.
author: Rubail B.

description: Tandoori chicken is the best, reasonable prices, washroom is horrible. Free tea with your order.
author: Ali J.

description:
I have heard nothing but great praises for this place and was pretty surprised when I tried them for lunch today at how mediocre my Chicken Makhanwala (butter chicken) was. It tasted like when I try to make butter chicken at home - not very creamy, very little flavor, and with immensely overcooked chicken. Like it's so overcooked, it tastes like it came out of a can. 

Service maybe isn't the best either. 

All their dishes are priced on the cheap because you add naan or rice if you would like them. 

Not sure I would try again...
author: K M.

description: Best Lamb & Goat Biryani in the Bay Area hands down!  The staff is great!
author: Steve D.

description: Don't let the dirty appearance throw you off.  This no-thrills restaurant is a must try.  The lamb curry melts in your mouth.  The chicken tikka masala is a savory curry taste explosion in your mouth.  The naan is good.  The Chai is complimentary.  It's relatively inexpensive Indian food compared to other places in town.  The area is sketchy at night so be vigilant.
author: Edmund Y.

description:
It's hard not to be down with cheap, tasty Indian food. While I wouldn't eat at the restaurant, it's conveniently located so that you can pick-up your food, get some beer, and be back home within 10 minutes time.

Try the Pakora, Veggie Samosa, or any of the other Vegetarian Delights.
author: Jon T.

description: This place is sooo good. Go here with a few people, load up with plenty of naan, and order some good curries. The gosht (beef one) is amazing. Eat it with some raita. Samosas are good. They come with chana masala which is also really good. Basically this place is hella flavorful. Just make sure they go all out with the spice. Tell them specifically!
author: Jessica S.

description:
Don't understand all the great reviews. This is the worst Indian I've ever had. 

Watery, tasteless butter chicken with really dry chicken. 

Tandoori was way too smokey for my tastes. Disgusting actually. Offensively smelled up my entire home too. 

The smoke also ruined the thin, dry, flaking apart naan. Yuck. 

The spinach/potatoes and eggplant dishes were ok. The latter being too spicy though for me. 

The lamb Biryani was pretty good.  

What a disappointment.
author: Sharon G.

description: We came here for lunch with a bunch of friends. It was packed but we didn't wait for to long to get a table. We ordered lamb and chicken briyani, chicken tikka masala, naan and chicken tandoori. Everything was good. Better than other Indian or Pakistani restaurant in the same neighborhood in my opinion and I think the price is reasonable as well. We will be back.
author: Mariner Z.

description: Great prices.. Everything is freshly cooked.. Will recommend if u like Desi food !! Bbq is excellent.. Like their chicken biryani as well
author: Auon T.

description: our children took us here for fathers day ! my husband likes indian food . I had the tiki chicken it was good and a beef dish.  I had some rice and some naan. all were pretty good I'm not much for spicy foods. my husband had goat .he also had some lamb rice dish ,which looked good. my daughter had some chicken dish and her husband had some lamb in gravy that he liked.
author: Nellie J.

description: I'm beyond disgusted with this place. I got some food yesterday delivered. Everything was pretty decent, I think my favorite was Mango Lassi... otherwise everything else was mediocre. To my surprise I found a black hard something in my Chicken Tikka Masala Dish. I was so close to getting ready to eat it until I saw this very black foreign object in my dish. I tried to slice it in half but then it got even weirder. I couldn't tell what it was and I became too scared to find out. I called them to let them know. I figured I could take care of it with them directly than to post something on yelp. They decided to refund me for just the chicken tikka masala. If  I wanted to, I could have really gotten to the bottom of this and really sued them for what could have been a beetle or some other dead creature. I decided to leave this review on Yelp because I am convinced never ever to go eat here and to be aware of most places you eat. It's not clean, they are after the money. Obviously if they cared about their business, they would have compensated me more than just the cost of the Chicken. I had a horrible and very scary experience and want to warn everyone of this place. Beware!!
author: Krisha C.

description:
I was pretty impressed by quality of the food in these place. 
They are cook very fast, but you should pick up your meal by yourself. Stuff is enough friendly.
I'm obviously will order delivery when I move out from that terrible hostel "Vantaggio"
author: Vasiliy M.

description: For cheap, delicious, and fast Indian food with good service, Pakwan is the best in the hood. I live right around the corner and eat here at least once per week. They have great lamb biryani, saag paneer and the NAAN is out of this world! The guys at the counter are super nice and personable as well.
author: Andrew S.

description: I've been twice in the O'Farrell location and once in the mission.  The good.  Their Biryani is excellent.  I went with a friend of mine whose been to India and he said that their Biryani is legit.  I personally loved it.  The portion is enough for 2 people and it's only $9.75.  A great deal.  The rest of their dishes are pretty average.  I was disappointed in their curries and their masalas.  The meats were bland and the sauces lacked the deep indian spices and were kind of on the thinner side.  Their naan breads, except for their Lamb Kulchas were dry and lacked the taste as some other great indian joints I've discovered in the Tenderloin.  I will go back for the Biryani alone but I would not go there if I'm craving let's say Chicken Korma and garlic naan.  There are way better places all with in walking distance.
author: Joey S.

description: This is definitely my favorite location! The food is excellent! Chicken Biryani and Saag Dal are my favorites! Chicken tikka masala and baigan bharta are just as delicious. Food is fresh and naan is soft. Customer service at this particular location is always great. I definitely recommend this place to all.
author: Yanni B.

description:
Great cheap eat in sf. For less than $9, get Chicken tikka masala and an order of naan. No frills, but good food.

Located in the tenderloin, but open late for an after bar snack
author: Vince E.

description: The goat curry was tender, tasty and perfect with the rice! I could have ordered just that and would have been totally satisfied, but I'm glad I got to try the other dishes because they were all delicious. A gem in the tenderloin.
author: Jade Y.

description:
Very Good food but very unclean place. This seems to be a common problem with restaurants of this type, shalimar in SanFran, Fremont, Dublin is the same, very dirty. I always clean cutlery with wet tissue, bathrooms are filthy to say the least. Honestly I would want to pay more and have all these guys maintain a clean place. Food must be prepared and served in hygienic place.
Food itself is excellent and low price
author: Asif H.

description: Two words. Food Poisoning. I had their paneer makhani and rice and naans saturday and spent sunday paying for it. I hadn't had food coming out both ends since living in india, and that is because water in india is bad. Kinda worried about their sanitation practices. I was going to send a sample to the DPH but was way to sick to be bothered. The good news is I lost a couple of pounds in a matter of hours! Caveat emptor.
author: Onika C.

description:
Food was fast good and ok priced. Self serve so fri nite dinner was relatively fast.
We had one of the best tandoori chicken, moist, and super tasty. 
But the best is the lamb chop with garlic Nan. The Briyani rice was good accompaniment too. 
However I have to warn you that the ventilation is really poor. You will smell of curry after you leave.
Overall I will order take out the next time.
author: Nelle L.

description: I orderd mild food then when I teasted was too super salty just like sea water . I went back to the cashier to complain about the food And I got a new food . After I got home the food was just the same thing . I had to order delivery and wait an hour from other place . And dump all salty food in garbage. Not happy
author: Sam A.

description:
I prefer to call myself a generous reviewer, so I'd say this place is OKAY.

Plus points:

1. Very reasonable - perfect for students.
2. Comfortable bachelor pad sort of ambiance. 
3. Polite, friendly and quite welcoming. 

Negative points:

1. Very oily food :( - Indian/Pakistani food does NOT have to be oily.
2. Slightly understaffed and a little slow in food preparation.
author: Rakshit K.

description:
I LOVE this place.  Super inexpensive, really fast.  Service is confusing so you know it's authentic (you get a number and go sit down, and the waiter will come and tell you when it's time to go get your food).

The naan is crispy and delicious, not too buttery but big enough to fill you up and then some.  And their lentils with spinach (Saag dal) I think have crack in them... I had them every day for probably three days straight and my craving still hasn't gone away.

The neighborhood is a little off-putting if you're not used to how mixed San Francisco can really be; it's very different from other cities that are class-divided by really distinct neighborhoods.  It's safe, though... remember the Hilton is a block over!

Great place for vegetarians and carnivores alike... everyone will leave stuffed!
author: Allison M.

description:
BEEN DINING HERE for well over a decade n maybe like 15 yrs. Their AROMA - above all and the BIRYANIS n Curries r just awesome !!! I love the divey, funky locale for gr8 SPICY/GREASY SPOON  cuisine makin' one feel transported momentarily 
to a distant SUBCONTINENTAL " MOHALLA' as in GHETTO !!! lol .....
SERVICE is even better now that the owner's son Danial Shahbaz spends a considerable amount of time there ' overseeing' things n offering a ' personal touch' ....

My favorites here r Garlic Naan done just right w/sprinkled cilantro, Lamb Curry,
Lamb, Chicken or Veg. Biryani , Capsicum curry to go along and the fabulous RAITHA YOGURT SAUCE n FRESHLY BREWED CHAI ...mint n tamarind chutneys r fab too ..... a MUST VISIT w/ live ennertainment/ never a dull moment out de window !!:-)))!!!

An apropos visit to the EXPRESS MARKET for an " after desi meal CAMEL" wraps things up just beautifully !!!!!
author: ANWAR H.

description:
Day 16/30: 30-day Oct yelp challenge

This dive-y stretch of SF (around Jones Street) is great for hole-in-the-wall Indian/Pakistan food.  We had an early afternoon flight and I was craving this type of food again so we wandered by the area to see what was open.

Pretty clean, very casual.  You order at the cash register and they call you when your food is ready.  Good portions and inexpensive (the two of us ate for $20 total and were stuffed).  Quality is between 3-4 stars depending on the item.  Loved their kabobs - both the beef and the chicken were flavorful and moist.  Their naan is only average - we had both the garlic and the stuffed beef (which is basically a beef kabob stuck inside the naan, not the kind where it's mixed up into the bread).  Naan is light but doesn't have the fluffiness and light butter that I usualy like.  Chana masala was OK and their raita was the runnier style, but still good.

Decent stop in the area for Indian/Pakistani food.
author: Katie F.

description:
Cleanliness = 0

Vegetable Biryani and Garlic Naan are good here. Baingan curry (eggplant) was really bad . 

Paneer Tikka Masala was so-so. Had better ones in other restaurants.
author: Sreenath K.

description: Got food delivered from here. Really good Pakistani food in my opinion and pretty authentic too.
author: Faraz S.

description: Not for vegetarians whatsoever.  Chole were mushy and not fresh, daal was just made with extra oil to make up for lack of taste.
author: Shreya S.

description: Loved the Biryani we picked up here on new years eve..Really wish i could gove more than 5 stars...Best Biryani i have had in the US..They offered complementary tea while we were waiting, which was tasty too. This place will be on our itinerary whenever we visit SF.
author: Gopinath S.

description: Not a fancy place. But awesome food. I will come back here again. We tried chicken biryani. It was close to authentic Pakistani biryani. The portion was good enough for two.
author: Kaush K.

description:
This is a review of delivery from Pakwan.

It is easy to order from Grubhub.com.

I did not track the actual delivery time.  But I do remember that it was reasonably fast.  The delivery person was professional and polite.  There is a $1.50 delivery fee.

The order minimum is relatively high ($20).

The chicken tikka masala was very-very good.  There was a nice blend of spices.  The chicken was tender.  The creamy sauce also made a great dip for the sides.

http://tinyurl.com/3edab4w

The vegetable samosas were also delicious.   The outer shell was crisp and the filling had a nice mix of spices.  My only complaint is that due to the fact they were resting on a bed of chick peas, the bottoms of the samosas  had become a little soggy.

http://tinyurl.com/3tsyz9v

The vegetable pakoras were crispy delights.  I loved them.  I could live off of them.  Taking them and dipping them into the masala sauce was a delight.

http://tinyurl.com/3soquqe

The vegetable biriyani was also quite nice.

http://tinyurl.com/3kvvm84

I do not know about their naan.  Doh - I forgot to order any.

Much of the food was neatly packed into clam-shell containers.  The rice and the entree were in easy to reseal plastic containers.

The prices were very reasonable.

1  Vegetarian Samosa  - $ 2.99
1  Chicken Tikka Masala  - $ 7.99
1  Plain Rice - $ 1.50
1  Vegetable Biryani - $ 6.99
1  Pakora - $ 2.00

Subtotal - $21.47
Tax - $1.82
Delivery Fee - $1.50
Total - $24.79

Overall, this was very good Indian food.  The service and prices were also reasonable.  I would definitely order from Pakwan again.
author: Mark D.

description: Happy we stumbled upon this place when we were looking for a quick lunch. Got the saag daal with garlic naan. Daal was great and naan was good, garlic was too dry/crispy. Lots of food without a huge bill which was a nice change from other places in SF
author: Amanda H.

description:
I love this place. There are many choices in the Tandoori-loin, but this one has great, cheap food and the staff are super friendly. I pick up my food on the way home from work and am always greeted with a smile. The place is clean and there's no better place to sit and watch all the shenanigans of the Loin, safely behind a large pane of glass. It's a real lively corner which I fondly refer to as Jonesing and O'Heroin. I guess all the food on this particular block is quite good and cheap, and while I don't necessarily need stellar service from an Indian joint, Pakwan has the nicest counter service. One of the other restaurants with a similar menu has a dude on a cell phone who can barely look up while he takes your order and usually gets it wrong. It's ok to ignore me for my $10 order, but at least get it right. Mostly cuz I'm too lazy to walk back two blocks to fix it.

They don't always have it, but when they do, try the dosas, they're really tasty. Love the tikka masala and aloo gobi and all of their veggie dishes are lovely and light without too much greasiness.
author: Carolyn T.

description:
(See pics)

Fairly spicy and delicious local joint. The food is rich. The sauce is thick but not as thick as Shalimar. The multiide of Pakistani / Inidan places in the Loin makes each of them unique, depending on your mood for the food, you will always find something you love.

I love this place's colorful ceiling covering and bright lighting. Most of the writings are in English and it makes the menu look less intimidating and you would not have to try to pronounce all the words.

The Karahi chicken was cooked with lots of black peppercorn and had a lot of flavors. Saag paneer was very rich with very good cheese cubes. and aloo paratha was solid.

These 3 items that cost less than 20 bucks was a very very good deal.
author: T L.

description:
Tick tock tick tock tick tock.

BURST!

Flavor. One huge burst of Indian flavor. A burst of spice, rice, and everything nice.

My good friend told me to try this Indian place located in a sketchy part of town. Naturally, I took that to mean "order delivery from them," which I did.

I've had tons of Indian food during my 22 years of existence, but I have never had it spiced so generously before. I'm not talking burn-your-mouth with hot chilli spice sent from hell. Rather, I tasted flavorful curries and cumins in all of my dishes, which is the reason I crave Indian food in the first place.

I got the following items and was satisfied with all of them:
- Chicken Briyani (amazing dish)
- Tikka Masala
- Saag Paneer

Delivery was fast and hot. However, the chicken portions were a bit on the skimpy side.

-----

Distinguishing factor: Dishes have more flavor than Flava Flav himself
author: Nick A.

description: I would not recommend this place at all. First off they sat us at a table with another guy hovering over us and we had to ask him to move to the side. Another guy comes over and sits on the same table in between us and starts eating. My chicken tikka masala was very cold n not tasteful. The tandoori chicken was somewhat decent. The gulaab jamoon were cold n I told him in the beginning to split it in two instead he brings it out 15 minutes later n says "do it yourself".  They are very select full of who gets catered first. The knives, forks and spoons had stains on them. This place is a filthy mess. I would not recommend this place even if you are dying of hunger. Overall it was a waste of my money and time. There are many other better restaurants in the area to eat.
author: A K.

description:
got delivery via postmates.  didn't expect much and it destroyed my expectations.  perhaps the  best lamb curry i've yet to have in SF (bhuna).  Tandoori chicken was amazing.  seekh kabab was ok.  will be returning back here frequently.

UPDATE (previous score was 5 stars, now 3) : 

I ordered from them 2 other times.  The next time it was the same awesome.  The following time, 1/3rd of the meat tasted awesome and 2/3rds of the meat was tough and lame.  so losing 2 stars for inconsistency.
author: reza n.

description:
Over time I've amassed an arsenal of weapons against the common cold - Emergen-C, OJ, neti pot, meth-grade pharmaceuticals, etc. The most recent addition is: food delivered from Pakwan, ordered extra-spicy. My sinuses couldn't be happier, as this place don't hold back. 

Even aside from the spice factor, Pakwan is top-notch stuff. I've been eating here for years and have yet to find an item they don't do well. I recommend, across the board - especially if you have a nasty cold hovering.
author: Janna M.

description: Best indian/pakistani food in the area
author: Zara R.

description: I love how divey this place is - you'll receive a number to bring back to your table once you've paid for the meal up front. As for the food, I can't speak authoritatively on Indian food, but I imagine it's what a home-cooked meal would taste like. A solid go-to.
author: Shendi X.

description:
Visited the place in the Weekend, The Weekend specials were yummy and tasty, Goat Biryani and Goat Kadhai along with the hot and fresh Nan .
My company was a vegetarian who not much pleased with Panner Makhani.
Definitely recommend this place for trying Indian cuisine .
author: Venkat Girish M.

description:
I have a friend who used to live in the 'Loin, across the way from me. We were talking food and drink in the area that we were fond of, like most loyal 'Loin dwellers tend to do. When I mentioned I hadn't been to Pakwan yet, she looked at me like I had just kicked the cutest puppy on the planet. I was taken aback, mainly because I'm the one usually giving people that look when talking SF food. 

She advised that I try out their tandori chicken STAT. Well, I'm never one to ignore the suggestions of fellow foodies so I tried it the following week... and she was right. I couldn't believe I had waited until then to taste this deliciousness. It was spicy and sweet and tender and BBQ-y and grilled to perfection. I'm already plotting my next visit. Who knows, maybe I'll "forget" to go grocery shopping next week and see where it leads me.
author: Julia N.

description: I wasn't sure what to think when I first walked into Pakwan, but I wasn't expecting fast food. Nevertheless, it didn't disappoint. The portions were generous, and the counter service was pleasant. The staff delivered the food to the table about when they had promised it. This was a great place to take our kids.
author: Amy H.

description: Third time order for delivery last three months. All food excellent and delivery ahead of estimate! Great food and service!
author: Steve F.

description: we were actually planning on going to the dirty hole-in-the-wall spot across the street but the city had shut them down, so we came here. chicken tikka masala and lamb vindaloo. ok spices. good portions. quick service. so dirty. utensils, sauce containers/spouts, plates, the entire place. i think it would have tasted better if it was to go and i ate it in my clean apartment haha. The chicken was better than the lamb. I wish they had butter chicken!
author: Zara S.

description: I adore Pakwan's veggie samosas. They cook fast and the price is very reasonable. Their curries are decent, although I prefer Lahore's.
author: Amanda S.

description: the problem with star ratings is they're not helpful if the person searching is interested in factors that the raters didn't have in mind when doing the rating..... SO.... this rating is based entirely on the food and a lack of any other cataclysmic occurrences (like, you know, getting cursed out by the one of the staff; getting mooned by another diner; water dripping from the roof onto my table etc., which did NOT happen here!).... based on THAT, it's 5 stars. the chicken tikka was fantastic. flavorful, spicy yogurt marinade. plentiful. the naan very fresh. two sauces for dipping: a milder yogurt sauce and a zippier, tangier, sweeter sauce, which i think was tamarind/date. the mango lassi was, to my sensibilities, all you can ask for..... this is a stripped down place. order at counter, they call out your number, you get the sauces from the fridge yourself, etc..... if you're looking for fantastic food, more than reasonable prices, and don't mind a non-fancy environment, pakwan's a great choice....
author: Tom C.

description:
Looks like an ordinary Indian place from the outside looking in.Their take away and delivery is very busy, which is always a good sign. 
Food was great not overly spicy, but enough for my taste. Portions are very fair. 2 persons meal was about 30 dollar.
author: Tom W.

description:
I've been hearing good things about this place for years but finally got to try it after the Yelp event at Mr. Lew's. 

It was delicious! I ordered my go to Indian favorites of chicken tikka masala and garlic naan. They were both good but I think I like Lahore Karahi's garlic naan a tad bit more.
author: Dani D.

description:
Out of all the Indian/Pakistani restaurants around this area, Pakwan should be your last choice. Shalimar is a step up, Chutney a step up from that. Lahore Karahi is by far my favorite out of the bunch. It's about a block and half away from the pack but well worth the short walk. 

Pakwan is always empty, so it has that going for it. It's also dirty. Enough said.
author: Sethy Wethy ..

description:
This is not the first time I've order Pakwan, nor will it be my last!!

Best Saag Paneer ever!  You can really taste the spices and the cheese curds in it are anything but flavorless! I tend to get the Chicken Makhanwala or the Chicken Tikka Masala. I also get the Saag Paneer but love to double up sometimes and get the Chana Masala. Definitely get the Naan too, I prefer plain Naan but I have tried their Garlic Naan and was not disappointed. 

Although embarrassing, I will admit that sometimes my boyfriend and I get all the Saag Paneer, Chana Masala, Chicken Makhanwala and the Chicken Tikka Masala. We also tend to get delivery, and its always less than the estimated 45 mins. 

Guaranteed happy food coma after Pakwan :)
author: Kate D.

description: I have eaten here often and have always liked it. This time I got take out through eat24. Severely disappointed. The achar chicken was flavorless. The sauce watery. It was in edible. The standard has fallen since the chef left to open his own place.
author: S P.

description: tandoori chicken was awesome with the garlic naan. That's all I ate and it was enough. I believe it was around $7. Chicken had great flavor.
author: Victor T.

description:
Pakwan is a mixed bag for me.  I have had some killer food but horrible service that makes up for my 1 star review.  I have to say that Pakwan on 16th I have never had a problem with but this restaurant in particular screwed it up big time.

I had placed an order on grubhub.com.  For those of you who don't know what it is, it's basically an app that tells you who delivers close to your home.  Anywho, after I placed my order the application states that the delivery time is estimated at 50mins.  This is typical and I understand it takes some time to process the order, prep, cook and deliver it so no biggie.  Well an hour goes by and I'm starving so I decide to call GrubHub. They quickly apologize and contact the restaurant.  They explain to me that the driver is out on delivery now and should be there in the next 15mins. I thought I'd wait it out a bit.  30 mins pass by.  It has now been an hour and a half past the time of ordering and 45mins past the time of stated delivery.  I decide to call the restaurant directly and they say that the driver is still out for delivery and he has included a Lassi drink for my inconvenience.  I decide to call GrubHub to see what they would do about the situation and they were kind enough to grant me $25 for my next purchase. Another 30mins go by (2 hours total now) and nothing.  No ring, no knock, no phone call.  It is now 9:30pm and I'm ready for bed.  I call grubhub and they apologize.  Remind you - I'm being very patient with all parties.  I just want my food that was prepaid for.  GrubHub contacts Pakwan and they said that the food was already delivered.  ...That's news to me since I'm still calling and trying to find my food.  The restaurant calls back in another 15mins and explains that the delivery driver left the food in the backseat and forgot about it.  Grubhub was kind enough to force them to credit half of my purchase price.

The food finally arrived at my doorstep around 2 hours and 45mins from the time I placed my order.  It is now 10:15 and the driver explains that he is incredibly sorry and get this...  he even says to me "The food is cold, just so you know.  But my manager said you can get a free dessert next time you order".  What am I supposed to do with almost 3 hour late food, that's COLD?  Eat it.  I was tired, upset, cranky because I hadn't eaten, and the best part of this whole thing.  The guy forgot my Lassi.
author: Kevin J.

description:
I was definitely not disappointed with this place - it has a ton of hype and it's well deserved.

Bhuna (Lamb Curry) - this is a great dish of savory and well-spiced lamb curry. The meat was very tender and the curry had a very robust flavor.  They actually don't take out the variety of spices they use to season the dish so don't be surprised to bite into an exotic spice that looks like a flower or seed.

Bengan Bhartha (Pakwan Style) - my least favorite of all the dishes I ordered, this was basically a curry-like dish with eggplant and tomatoes in a paste-like consistency, which had flavor, but lacked distinction since the eggplant and tomatoes were all mixed together...it wasn't bad, but not all that great.

Chicken Tikka Masala - a great dish of tender chicken cooked in a very well-seasoned  sauce.

Raita (Yogurt) - a great side of spiced yogurt that went well with the entire meal.

Chawal - The rice was slightly spiced and perfect to help clean the palate from the extremely savory main dishes

Keema Nan - a ground beef stuffed nan, this was a perfect way to start the meal.  It was great for immediately satisfying those hunger cravings.

This was a great spot for Pakistani/Indian food and I'd definitely recommend this place for anyone who enjoys well-seasoned and well-spiced food.
author: Ken G.

description:
Amazing! Delicious! Perfect!
This place is one of the best! 

As we stumbled out of Bourbon and Branch, Pakwan was there to welcome us in to its aromatic arms.

My faves are the lamb curry and chicken tikka masala. But let them recommend something for you, you won't be sorry.
author: Dayna P.

description:
Mmmm so good! My cousins and I went there and tried a couple of their dishes. The ones I HIGHLY recommend is the tandori chicken. Pakwan makes their tandori chicken with the right tenderness and it's not overcooked like ones I've had elsewhere. The tandori is also pretty bomb with that extra lime they add to the plate. 

Also highly recommend the extra spicy lamb dish. It's got the kick, and they cook their lamb well here. The chicken tikka masala and the butter chicken were pretty similar and good. 

Only complaint was the dessert. The coconut dessert was a hard swallow. I like coconut desserts usually, but if you're like me and not into tasting bready-textured things in your dessert, it's not for you.
author: Ting T.

description: Had a very delicious Meal. Had ordered dal and chicken.. Enjoyed the meal a lot..  Me and my husband were starving when we reached, the service was real quick.. Didn't have to wait long. Will recommend the place to all.
author: Aakriti S.

description:
Great service, great food, great environment! Great great great! 

I've been to this restaurant quite a few times in the past few months and I have to say I have nothing bad to say about this restaurant. They prepare the food in a timely fashion and get it to you on time whether its busy or not through delivery, pick-up, or eating in. 

It's understandable that when busy the delivery or pick up or eating in might be a little late because of the many orders they takes time for the food to prepare. They have great service even though its self-service but the people that work there are kind and very friendly. If I seem to have any problem with my food or anything they fix it right up and tend to my special requests/needs. 

Definitely recommend going here its an experience that you have to check it out for yourself! Will be coming back more often.
author: Arsikh J.

description:
Really obliging service. When I said that I didn't eat dairy, they were so helpful. They not only showed me what items on the menu were dairy free, they also made special bread for me! Amazing!
Food was REALLY tasty and authentic. I felt like I was back in North India! 
I saw some reviewers complain that the food is oily. Yes, some dishes can be - but that is the cuisine of the region, it is like complaining that French cooking uses too much butter! Just tell them that you don't want too much oil, and I am sure they will be obliging.
author: Elizabeth K.

description:
